law

Define a length law of LRs using equal amplitudes method from measured data.

Created on Tue Feb 17 12:56:51 2015

@author: ndour

hydroroot.law.discretize(x, y, size=0.05)[source]

Discretize by 5cm-intervals by using equal amplitudes method

Parameters

  • x –

  • y –

  • size – (Default value = 5e-2)

hydroroot.law.expovariate_law(data_xy, size=0.05, scale_x=0.01, scale_y=1000.0, plot=False)[source]

Fit a spline law from measured data by adding stochasticity.

To compute the law, data are first sampled using equal amplitude method. Then, a mean is computed on each sample. Then, an expovariate distribution is simulated from the mean of each sample. Finally a spline is interpolated based on the simulated data.

Parameters

  • data_xy – the data to fit

  • size – the sample size (Default value = 5e-2)

  • scale_x – a scaling factor on x array (Default value = 1e-2)

  • scale_y – a scaling factor on x array (Default value = 1e3)

  • plot – True plot the law (Default value = False)

  • Example – 

>>> filename = 'lr_length_law_data.csv'
    >>> xy = readCSVFile(filename)
    >>> law = fit_law(data_xy=xy, size=5e-2)
hydroroot.law.histo_relative_law(x, y, size=0.05, scale_x=1.0, scale_y=0.001, scale=0.0001, plot=False, uniform=False)[source]
Parameters

  • x – list of float

  • y – list of float

  • size – float (Default value = 5e-2)

  • scale_x – float (Default value = 1.)

  • scale_y – float (Default value = 1e-3)

  • scale – float (Default value = 1e-4)

  • plot – unused (Default value = False)

  • uniform – string or boolean (Default value = False)

  • position – expo

  • min – and max

  • return – func

  • Algorithm –

  • First – discretize the X values in different intervals of size

  • Compute – the histogram from the set of points include in each interval

  • Return – a function that compute a value in a given histogram

hydroroot.law.length_law(pd, scale_x=0.01, scale_y=1.0, scale=0.0001, uniform='expo', size=5)[source]

Build the function giving the lateral length according to its position on the parent branch

Parameters

  • pd – DataFrame

  • scale_x – float (Default value = 1 / 100.)

  • scale_y – float (Default value = 1.)

  • scale – float (Default value = 1e-4)

  • uniform – boolean or string (Default value = ‘expo’)

  • size – (Default value = 5)

Returns

  • a function giving the lateral length according to its position

hydroroot.law.reference_relative_law(x, y, size=0.05, scale_x=1.0, scale_y=0.001)[source]
Parameters

  • x –

  • y –

  • size – (Default value = 5e-2)

  • scale_x – (Default value = 1.)

  • scale_y – (Default value = 1e-3)

Returns

Algorithm

  • First, discretize the X values in different intervals of size size.

  • Compute the histogram from the set of points include in each interval.

  • Return a function that compute a value in a given histogram
